overview.note: Students choose which standards to attempt. They do NOT have to do all 4.

standards.title: Explore data using a statistical enquiry process
topics: Statistical enquiry cycle (PPDAC: Problem, Plan, Data, Analysis, Conclusion)
standards.note: Internally assessed by teachers, externally moderated by NZQA

standards.title: Use mathematical methods to explore problems that relate to life in Aotearoa New Zealand or the Pacific
standards.assessment_method: School-based investigation/project with real-world NZ/Pacific context
topics: Must use at least 4 different mathematical processes from at least 2 areas
standards.note: Context-based problem solving relevant to Aotearoa NZ or Pacific communities

standards.title: Use algebraic methods to solve problems
standards.assessment_method: Written exam at end of year

exam_structure.question_2: Quadratics: factorising, solving, discriminant, word problems
exam_structure.question_4: Multi-step real-life problem with perimeter, area, solving

standards.title: Demonstrate mathematical reasoning
standards.assessment_method: Written exam at end of year
topics: Volumes and surface areas (spheres, prisms, cylinders)

exam_timetable_2024.note: External exams (91946 + 91947) are combined into ONE 3-hour exam paper
exam_timetable_2024.exam_format: Both standards assessed in single sitting

how_students_choose.description: Students select which standards to attempt based on:
factors: Their strengths (algebra vs geometry vs statistics)
School offerings (not all schools offer all standards)
typical_combinations: All 4 standards (20 credits) - for strong students
Both externals + 1 internal (15 credits) - most common
Both externals only (10 credits) - minimum for math contribution
Mix and match based on ability

grading.subject_endorsement: 14+ credits at Merit or Excellence (including 3+ external, 3+ internal)
